SENT.plain: An 18-year-old man presented with a history of oral sores and presence of high fever, scrotal ulcerations and haemoptysis
Multiple mural cardiac masses were present in the right atrium, right ventricle and left ventricle

Furthermore, pulmonary vasculitis with aneurysm formation and venous thrombosis involving the superior sagittal sinus and right transverse sinus were found, and the diagnosis was made of (incomplete) Behçet's disease
While receiving anticoagulation and later, treatment with prednisone and cyclophosphamide, the cardiac thrombi gradually disappeared
We stress the importance of early echocardiography to evaluate cardiac abnormalities in Behçet's disease
